instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2011 MacBook Pro with GPU related error in VST
threads.message: Now that Apple is no longer replaceing any of the 2011 boards that exhibit GPU problems what is the procedure to repair these? I have heard in the past that the GPU is not nessicarly the underlying factor to the reason these boards fail ( cause the system to crash or not boot) and report bad in Apple VST tests. I assume that the solution to this problem is something similar to the 2012 Retina model where a chip needs to be replaced or re-set in some way. Can anybody confirm this and possibly direct me to the chip in question that is causing these known issues?

threads.title: 2011 MacBook Pro with GPU related error in VST
threads.message: No it is the GPU. Replace it and don't be an idiot like me and livestream yourself using the wrong GPU!

threads.title: 2011 MacBook Pro with GPU related error in VST

I think its funny that you call yourself an idiot when you are clearly one of the smartest people here

threads.title: 2011 MacBook Pro with GPU related error in VST
threads.message: Is it also the GPU if i measure PP1V5_GPU_REG at 1.35V instead of 1.5, or do i need to look at something else?

threads.title: 2011 MacBook Pro with GPU related error in VST
threads.message: It is the GPU......heat it and it will work again. Then put a new one on there. 1.35V is fine, it is switchable between 1.35 or 1.5.
